climbs.name: Tales of the Grip
climbs.fa: Angel M and Jeremiah H: December 2018

content.description: This route start on the left side of the cave.  It starts with a bouldery move to a ledge.  Enjoy your rest on the ledge! From here it is a restless journey of crimpers, dynamic and technical moves.  It mellows down towards the end with some 5.10 moves that feels like 5.12d when you get there.
content.protection: 12 bolts and 2 bolted anchors with carabiners
content.location: It is on the middle of the wall.  It starts right of the small cave.

content.description:
It starts 15 feet below the tree with a trickery slab and some side pulls moves ending at the base of the tree.  The route continues right and up from the tree with the crux just below the last bolt.

 It is a good warm up for the area.
content.protection: 12 bolts with two bolted anchors with carabineers.
content.location: Left most route on the wall.

content.description: This route has the characteristic of a serial killer.  It took for ever to clean up and it was not giving up easily.  Spitting out Refrigerator Block aiming straight to you.  It is a little sandy at the start, but it is cleaning up.  It is pumpy for the grade and tricky to clip the anchors.   It has a high first bolt but it is easy to get too.  Enjoy the middle no hand rest! Probably the first climb in the Sierra Vista surrounding area that has an FA by a native Sierra Vistan!
content.location: The route is located two routes right of the crack.

climbs.name: Crackenstein
climbs.fa: Angel M, Christian and Greg K: Nov 2018

content.description: The route follows the pronounce crack of the main Pumpkin Patch wall.  The route will test your endurance. It is a very good route that progressively starts to get harder and eases off at the last bolts to the anchor.
content.protection: 12 bolts with 2 chain anchors with carabiners.
content.location: It is in between Tales of the Crimp and Portrait of a Serial Climber.

content.description:
This route is very tricky and with the crux at the middle.  The routes got its name for the audience admiring the send from a far...

 The route will be better with a 70 meter rope.  A 60 meter will need to have a knot at the end of the ropes.
content.protection: 14 bolt, one permanent draw and two bolt anchors with carabiners

content.description:
Ashy Slashy cuts a jagged line up technical face, through a puzzle of churt, and gets a little bit groovy before the first rest, then slice up and right with balancy moves through churt knobs. Rest again and ascend the final roof where you are 6 feet under the anchor.  

 The first bolt is for shorties, though you may want to consider stick clipping the 2nd bolt.
content.protection: About 12 bolts to chain anchors with steel carabiners.
content.location: Start atop blocks leaning against the wall.  Currently the second route left of Jeepers Crimpers.

content.description: The route starts with some balancy moves with side pulls and crimpers to a small ledge at the second bolt.  It continues with some moderate climbing up the last four bolts. The crux is technical and a little pumpy towards the anchors.
content.location: Second route from left to right

climbs.name: A Nightmare on Crack Street
climbs.fa: FA: Erica Koebke and Andrea Bracamonte

content.description: This is a pretty mellow route.  It follows a crack to a bulge.  Go up the bulge and continue to some balancy techy sections.
content.protection: 8 bolts and 2 bolted anchors with carabiners.
content.location: The further right route on the wall.

content.description: Be ready to enter the Pumpkin Patch, if you dare!  This halloween theme wall gets some morning sun and by noon it gets into the shade.  It is currently being developed and it has a handful of routes.  The routes on this area range from 5.7-5.12+.
